## createDOMView() function

Create DOM view service (view primitives + on + mount)

Use this when you need to share signals between multiple adapters (e.g., DOM + Canvas in the same app).

**Signature:**

```typescript
createDOMView: ({ signals, }: {
    signals: Use<SignalsSvc>;
}) => Use<DOMViewSvc>
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

{ signals, }


</td><td>

{ signals: [Use](../../lattice/use/)<!-- -->&lt;[SignalsSvc](../../signals/signalssvc/)<!-- -->&gt;; }


</td><td>


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

[Use](../../lattice/use/)<!-- -->&lt;[DOMViewSvc](../domviewsvc/)<!-- -->&gt;

## Example

With shared signals

```ts
import { createSignals } from '@lattice/signals/presets/core';
import { createDOMView } from '@lattice/view/presets/dom';

const signals = createSignals()();
const dom = createDOMView(signals);
const canvas = createCanvasViewSvc(signals);

export const { signal, computed } = signals;
export { dom, canvas };
```
